fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Any Kanban project with Backlog and Epic Panel enabled can present this issue. Having subtasks displayed in the backlog upon an Epic selection from the Epic panel view generates an empty grey area in between the issue list if the selection results in a smaller number of subtasks without the filter.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Kanban project
 # Enable Backlog by dragging a status into the Backlog column under the Columns options from the respective board settings
# Create subtasks to be displayed in the Backlog selection
# Ensure these are under an Epic's child issue
# Open the Backlog page
# Open the Epic Panel
# Browse through the Epics and notice the grey area enlarge with empty space and shrink as they differ in number of subtasks

h3. Expected Results
Grey area should be responsive enough to not let empty spaces in the backlog section and only appear upon subtasks appearence

h3. Actual Results
Grey area is displayed in different sizes with empty spaces.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Empty grey area in the backlog of Kanban boards when viewing an Epic Panel selection

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
System groups like "jira-servicedesk-users" have some product users such as Trello and when you use an assignee rule with round-robin option from one of these system groups Automation includes also the product users

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a rule that includes the assign issue action using round-robin and from "jira-servicedesk-users" or "jira-software-users" group.
 # Trigger the rule and Automation will assign the system users
https://share.getcloudapp.com/nOuD1wmR

h3. Expected Results
Only users listen in the admin page should be used

h3. Actual Results
System users not visible on the admin page are used

h3. Workaround
Create a group with the required users or use "A user in the defined list" in the rule.
fields.summary: Automation for Jira: assign rule with round-robin option assigning system users from the system groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user adds the "Progress (issue count)" progress field to a plan, the progress bar shows the progress bar using the estimation unit of the plan (story points or time estimation) instead of showing the issue count. The documentation [Monitoring progress of work|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapscloud/monitoring-progress-of-work-998651252.html] says:

{quote}
If you hover on the progress bar of a parent issue, the breakdown of work will take into account the number of issues in the different status categories, the total number of issues in the plan, and the percentage of the number of issues in each status category against the total number of issues.
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a plan using at least one project as the issue source
# Make sure your plan has some epics with stories under it
# Transition different issues from this project used in the plan to different statuses
# In the plan's view, click on *Fields*, search for *Progress (issue count)* and click on it to add this to the plan's view
# Click the progress bar next to an epic

h3. Expected Results

The progress bar shows the number of issues under the epic.

 !progress-issue-count-cloud.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The progress bar shows the estimation unit used in the issues under the epic.

 !Screen Shot 2020-12-22 at 3.39.46 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using issue count progress in Advanced Roadmaps shows estimation units instead

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The customer would like to auto-schedule issues in parallel when issues are grouped by teams 

h3. Suggested Solution
When issues are grouped by teams in a plan, customers would like the issues assigned to teams to get scheduled parallelly.  

h3. Why this is important
Currently, the auto-scheduler is scheduling issues based on the sequence of the issues/teams on the plan. Introduce the feature to parallelly schedule issues from all the teams that are present in the view.
fields.summary: Ability to parallelly auto-schedule issues for all teams in advanced roadmaps

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After the change to the release notes functionality as per [Atlassian Cloud changes Dec 7 to Dec 14, 2020|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2020/12/atlassian-cloud-changes-dec-7-to-dec-14-2020], the release notes feature in Jira Software Cloud supports only Markdown formatting:
{quote}*Enhanced release notes functionality*
 _ROLLING OUT_

Access the enhanced release notes functionality by navigating to _Releases > Version > Release notes_. The revised Release notes page in your Jira Software project provides you with the following options:
 * Create release notes in the markdown format
 * Regenerate release notes based on layout and issue types
 * Format and update release notes in the editor
 * Copy the release notes to the clipboard

[Create release notes|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/create-release-notes/]
{quote}
Prior to the above change, customers had the ability to export release notes in HTML format as well.
h3. Suggestion

Ability to export release notes in HTML format.
fields.summary: Ability to export release notes in HTML format along with Markdown in Jira software cloud

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, Simple Roadmaps can't be used cross-project. That means that issues outside the current project's scope won't be considered within the Roadmap.

But, the Roadmap won't give any warn whether or not there are issues that won't be considered, which could make users be unaware of such existing work.

h3. Suggestion

Have Roadmap display a flag or some kind of warn when there are issues outside the scope under the Epics within the roadmap.
fields.summary: Roadmap should warn if there are issues outside of the project scope within Epics

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Assigning an epic color to one of the Epics in the Epic panel will break the ranking of epics.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Epics can be ranked in the epic panel as per the requirement.
* After assigning any color of your choice to one of the epics, it will not be possible to rank or re-arrange the epics.
* Even closing the Epic panel will not make any difference.
* Refresh of the page will restore the ranking functionality for epics.


h3. Expected Results
Should be able to re-arrange the epics

h3. Actual Results
Unable to rank epics after the color assignment.

h3. Workaround
Refreshing the page makes the epic ranking possible once again.

h3. Notes
Here is a [video|https://share.getcloudapp.com/OAuW81AE] to describe the behavior
fields.summary: Assigning an epic color to one of the Epics in the Epic panel will break the ranking of epics.

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When we click on Quick filters on the Backlog page, it would refresh the page and keep any filters applied e.g. an assignee. Now clicking on backlog will strip off the Assignee parameter but the page will not refresh, it needs a manual refresh to view all the backlog information.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Go to Backlog and click on any Assignee quick filter
- This will show only the issues that are assigned to the assignee.
- Now click on the Backlog page, though it will strip off the assignee parameter from the URL the backlog page is not refreshed.
- We need to manually refresh the page in order to view all the issues in the backlog.


h3. Expected Results
It should show all the issues in the backlog.

h3. Actual Results
It still shows issues from the selected assignee.

h3. Workaround
Manual refresh is needed to populate all the issues in the backlog.

h3. Notes
Here is a [Video|https://share.getcloudapp.com/8LunDgNX]
fields.summary: Backlog needs a manual refresh after the Assignee quick filter is applied

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, when an issue is added to an epic in next-gen, Jira fires the Issue Updated for the child issue, but not for the Epic Parent. This is causing only one automation rule to be triggered for the child but not for the epic, even though the Epic's history indicates that Epic Child was updated. 

(Epics in classic are unaffected.)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an automation rule with an issue updated as a trigger event. 
 # Add Issue to an Epic
 # The rule is triggered once for the child, although the parent was updated as well. 

h3. Expected Results

Adding Stories to Epics should trigger the rule for both issues. 
h3. Actual Results

Only the Story throws the rule once. 
h3. Affected Components

Epics in next-gen

Automation for jira
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Adding an issue to an epic in next-gen does not trigger an "issue updated" event

fields.description:
Dear team,

*As a Jira fan, I want to be able to track epic child issues across different projects in the roadmap view so that I always have a holistic overview of the status of an epic.* 

I am aware that this is possible with the advanced roadmap feature, but this is really no rocket science. By nature, epics can have child issues from different projects.

Also, think this from a business case perspective. If I want to convince my colleagues of the benefits of Advanced Roadmaps, I must be able to first lock them in on the benefits of the standard roadmap. Without being able to see child issues from other projects, we will not even try out the standard roadmap feature. 

What do you think? Quick improvement? ;)
fields.summary: Roadmap Feature / Show child issues from other projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Cloning a closed ticket will clone sprint history for a cloned ticket as well

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue, add it to different sprints until complete it, then close the ticket
# Clone Closed ticket.
# Open the new ticket created.

h3. Expected Results

1. No history information for sprints should be cloned.
2. Only the open sprint should be added to the ticket if the option to copy the sprint is selected.

All the sprints listed in the "Sprint" field in the closed issue is copied to the cloned one.

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
Hello Atlassian Team !!!

We urgently need to define different workflows for different types of tickets as part of the project implemented in JIRA Clouds next-gen type. While saving a new workflow for Epic, I received a notification that different workflows for the remaining ticket types will be available soon. So, I started looking for detailed information and received contradictory information on the pages:

(1) [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/whats-new/next-gen#intheworks] 

_"Workflows per issue type and column status mapping {color:#FF0000}*COMING IN 2021*{color}_
_We're bringing a new way to define, adapt, and adjust how work flows on your board by giving you more control of how your work progresses to match how your team works._

_Each issue type can have its own specific set of statuses, transitions, and rules. So when work moves forward, it moves to the checkpoints you've already defined._

_Columns and statuses on your boards will be decoupled so you can map multiple statuses to a single column creating a more focused and concise board. We'll even give you a dedicated space to manage it all, helping to distinguish set up things from work things. "_

(2) [https://www.atlassian.com/roadmap/cloud?selectedProduct=jsw] 

"Jira next-gen projects
*{color:#FF0000}COMING SOONQ4 2020{color}*
_Workflow editing in next-gen projects_
_Jira Software_
_Customize your workflow for different issue types and processes in next-gen projects"_

 

So, I don't know now when the functionality will be available: Q42020 or COMING IN 2021.

{color:#FF0000}*Could you please specify when exactly do you plan to implement this change? You will make a great Christmas present to implement it this year :)*{color}


Thank you.
fields.summary: Different workflows for different types of tickets as part of the project implemented in JIRA Clouds next-gen type

fields.description:
Advanced Roadmaps plans are considering the estimation of done issues in previous sprints if the due date falls into the active sprint timeframe.
h4. Steps to Reproduce
 # In your Scrum board:
 ## Create 2 issues:
 ### *Story 1*
 ### *Story 2*
 ## Create 2 sprints:
 ### *Sprint 1*
 ### *Sprint 2*
 ## Put *Story 1* in *Sprint 1*
 ## Put *Story 2* in *Sprint 2*
 ## *Start* the sprint *Sprint 1*
 ## *Set* the *Story 1* to *DONE*
 ## *Complete Sprint 1*
 # *Create a plan* using that Scrum board as issue source
 # Group the plan by Team, and enable *Show capacity on timeline*
 # Find *Story 1 and:*
 ## *set its start date* to *any date before or equal to the Sprint 2 start date*
 ## *set its due date* to *any date after or equal to the Sprint 2 start date*
 # *Find* *Story 2* and *add an estimate of 3 story points*
 # Click on the *Sprint 2 "box"* to display *the sprint 2 fly-out*
 # On the *sprint fly-out,* the *velocity* label will be *3 / <X> pts velocity*
 # Now find *Story 1* and add an estimate of *7 story points*

h4. Expected Results

On the *Sprint 2 fly-out*, the velocity label should still be *3 / <X> pts velocity.*
h4. Actual Results

On the *Sprint 2 fly-out*, the velocity label is now *10 / <X> pts velocity.*

This animated video highlights the issue based on the reproduction steps listed above:

!sprint-capacity-calculation-impacted-by-done-stories.gif|width=1096,height=477!
h4. Workaround
 * Update the *due date* to the *resolution date* when the *ticket is completed*, so it does not potentially fall into a future sprint
 * Use the *End date field instead of the Due date field* for the configured end date of your plan
 * Use *inferred dates from sprints* instead of *fixed dates*
fields.summary: The Story points of issues done in previous sprints are taken into consideration in the capacity calculation of active / future sprints

h3. Issue Summary

When releasing on a Kanban board, you can create a new one on the fly, defining its release date.

Currently, if your language is set to one of the following languages listed below, you won't be able to use the default date values that you select because Jira won't accept the month abbreviation used in Portuguese:
 !Screen Shot 2020-12-09 at 16.05.35.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2020-12-09 at 16.05.23.png|thumbnail!

h3. Languages Affected:
* Portuguese
* Spanish

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Set your profile language to *Português (Brasil)* at https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences
* Attempt to release a new version with a date that is on a month whose abbreviation differs from English.

h3. Expected Results

The release will be created successfully.

h3. Actual Results

Jira will say that the date is invalid:
{quote}
Data de release inválida
{quote}

h3. Workaround

Change your profile language to *English*, or, manually edit the date, changing the abbreviation of the name of the month to its corresponding English one:
* Examples:
** Dez -> Dec
** Fev -> Feb

Even if you change that when releasing, you will still see the dates in PT-BR when viewing the releases:
 !Screen Shot 2020-12-09 at 16.01.56.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Release date does not accept some months' abbreviations according to the profile language

These are more ad-hoc or small pieces of work that they have to execute. So these teams or members of these teams are not allocated within the roadmap of these initiatives.

Because all related work might not yet been set in Epics, Stories, etc..., to be able to assign this to a team.

From management perspective we want to see which supporting teams are requested to participate on initiatives.

But we want these teams to know that they need to participate. So we have setup shared teams for this matter, but we want to be able to set more than one team to an initiative.

Off-course we could use custom fields or components (per project, very administrative work) for this. But the teams option from advanced roadmap would be preferred as we want to start to use the capacity of the team option as well in the near future.

 # Creating an issue and selecting the component value for this new creating issue at the same time.

The problem is that the visualization of the priority in the board when you have card layouts set to display them is wrong then; rather than displaying the actual priority name, it will display it as _None_, even though the priority icon is correct.
See the screen-shot below as example:
 !image-2020-11-26-13-16-02-916.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a board card layout to display the Priority field
 # Head to your Priorities configuration in Jira
 # Select one priority and edit it
 # Add an empty space to the end of the priority icon URL
 # Head to the board ensuring that there is an issue with the respective priority selected being displayed there

h3. Expected Results
* Priority name shouldn't be impacted and it should be displayed as usual

h3. Actual Results
* Priority name is affected and displayed as _None_ regardless of the priority name configured and displayed in the issue view.

h3. Workaround
Not a workaround, but you can fix it by simply reviewing the priority icon URLs and search for these empty spaces.

h3. Issue Summary

When accessing “Agile board” option from “Filters” > Done issues > Sub task on a closed sprint under a next-gen project, getting "Error type: 500 - Internal server error"

When accessing Done Task or Story from the same closed sprint - no issue.

Issue seem specific to subtasks under next-gen projects.
 No issues for subtask under Classic projects
h3. Steps to Reproduce

to replicate:
 # On a project create a story, task and sub task as an example
 # Create a sprint
 # Mark these issues as Done
 # Complete sprint
 # Go to Filters > Advanced issue search > Filter by your project and Done issues
 # Go to the far side of the screen > “…” > select “Agile board” board option

h3. Expected Results

You will be routed to the related Board or to the related sprint report
h3. Actual Results

You get the following error:
{code:java}
Something went wrong
Try reloading the page, then check our Statuspage for any current outages. If there are no relevant outages, create a support request so we can help you out.

If you create a request, include the following so we can help you as fast as possible:

Error type: 500 - Internal server error
Log reference: ca76bca4-6c15-4f91-ae51-c52f209a6b3d
{code}
h3. Workaround

You can go to the related board through the parent issue

fields.description:
Currently, it is only possible for issues to depend on other issues.  

But if we cannot begin development on Feature A until version 1.2 is released, the only way for me to represent that in my Advanced Roadmaps plan is to create issues that represent releases.  This creates confusing redundancy and extra work for anyone planning product development timelines.

Please make it possible for releases to stand in as a dependency for issues *and* other releases in Advanced Roadmaps.

Hello all,

Thank you for watching, voting, and commenting on this issue.

We understand the current status of this Suggestion maybe unclear as updates have been split across 2 tickets. To avoid further confusion we will be closing this ticket and consolidating all feedback and updates under JSWCLOUD-12539.

To summarise where we are at, earlier in September 2021 we released an implementation of this Suggestion to a cohort of users as an experiment. After overwhelming feedback on this ticket and through other channels we decided to roll back this implementation. While the feature alleviated pain for some customers, it unfortunately did not meet customer expectations.

Jira Software

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, XSRF tokens are not refreshed automatically and we have seen an increasing number of customers who are getting the error message *{{'XSRF security token missing'}}* multiple times in a day.

This is happening to them across multiple browsers and after full cache clearing or re-installation of the browser.

Most commonly this is happening when transitioning in rapid boards.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

_NB. (only for affected users, intermittent issue.)_
 # Use Jira as normal.
 # Work on an issue.
 # Go to a rapid board
 # Try to transition the issue status.

h3. Expected Results

The issue should transition as normal
h3. Actual Results

The following error is shown to the user:


!image-2020-11-19-16-54-36-781.png|width=176,height=103!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior as a permanent fix. A workaround will be added here when available.

However, clearing your browser cache will reduce the time between XSRF tokens expiring
fields.summary: XSRF session token expiring frequently - Rapid Boards
